text.p: Following are the main stories in Croatian newspapers on Thursday.
- Serbs in Eastern Slavonia will, as of Sunday, be able to watch Croatian Radio Television (HRT) election promotion clips directed by UNTAES.

- The government to announce proportional system local elections in 10 days time at the latest, in line with the regulations which stipulate for an annoucement on the holding of local elections to be made at least 30 days before they are being held.

- The new law on the city of Zagreb to be presented before the government at its Thursday's session. Members of the opposition think that the Croatian Democratic Union (HDZ) might capture 35 percent of the vote at the next Zagreb elections, thus also ensuring the seat of mayor for its candidate.

- New mothers send a letter of protest to the parliament speaker, Vlatko Pavletic, following an abrupt parliament decision to reduce all payments received by working mothers after six months of maternity leave to 1,540 kuna, equalizing their status with non-working mothers who receive the same amount.
- 40 flats to be awarded to war invalids by March 1.
- Constitutional court scraps certain legislation amendments regarding the purchase of flats for indivisuals who have tennant rights.

- U.N. transitional administrator in Eastern Slavonia, general Jacques Klein tells the Serbs living in the region to either opt for a comfortable life in Croatia or to live as refugees in a foreign country.
- We are building a 21-century army, says in an interview the Bosnian Federation defence minister, Ante Jelavic. -- Zagreb Newsroom, 385-1-4557075
